items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion, Consideration and/or Action regarding Selection/Appointment of Measure G and Measure E Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee Members
	 
	 
Because the terms of service for community members serving on the Measure G and Measure E Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) ended in February of 2011, the district advertised for members to serve on the CBOC.  Advertisements were announced in the newspaper, schools, district office and district’s website.  The CBOC is required to have a least seven members that meet the criteria listed below.  Additionally, the outgoing CBOC recommended that the Board increase parent representation on the Committee.
	 
One (1) member shall be active in a business organization representing the business community located within the district.
One (1) member shall be active in a senior citizens’ organization.
One (1) member shall be active in a bona fide taxpayers’ organization.
One (1) member shall be the parent or guardian of a child enrolled in the district.
One (1) member shall be both a parent or guardian of a child enrolled in the district and be active in a parent-teacher organization, such as the Parent Teacher Association or the School Site Council.
Two (2) members of the community at-large.
	 
No employees or officials of the District can be appointed to the CBOC.  Also vendors, contractors, or consultants of the District are not allowed to serve as members of the Committee.
	 
	 
From the twenty-five community applicants, administration recommends the appointment of the following 14 candidates to serve on the Measure G and Measure E Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee.  Those with an asterisk “*”, if appointed, will serve only one year as former ESUHSD CBOC members.
	 
Active in a business organization – John Delgado
Active in a senior citizens’ organization – Elizabeth Martinez
Active in a bona fide taxpayer’s organization – Andres Quintero
Parent / guardian of a child in the district – Cecil Lawson (AH)
Parent / guardian of a child in the district and active in a parent-teacher organization – Derek Grasty (EV)
Two members of the community at large – Jon Reinke* (ST); Julio Saucedo (AH) 
	 
Additional Recommended Members:
	 
Bill Bascom (SC)
Sherry Gilmore (SC)
David Hernandez*
John Moore* 
Martin Reinders (ST)
Rao Tallapragada (EV)
Tim Tom 
	 
The administration would like to thank the following community members for their interest and willingness to serve on the CBOC.
	 
Jeremy Barousse
Joshua Barousse
Rebecca Gallardo 
William Jakel**
Bill Murphy
Bob Nunez 
Tien Pham
Michael Rapp
Barry Schimmel
John Sellarole**
Susan Williams
	 
**Former ESUHSD CBOC Members
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
RECOMMENDATION:
	It is recommended that the Board of Trustees appoint persons to serve on the Measure G and Measure E Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee as recommended by Administration.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees appoint persons to serve on the Measure G and Measure E Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee as recommended by Administration.
items.item_text: Discussion, Consideration, and/or Action regarding Selection/Appointment of Measure G and Measure E Citizens' Bond Oversight Committee Members - Dan Moser, Superintendent

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.02
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT
Review and Approve Recommended Process for Selection of Professional Services for Phase 2 of Measure E Bond Program
	 
	 
Administration and staff are nearing completion of the planning process for Phase 2 of Measure “E,” which will include approximately $53,000,000 in new construction projects at the District’s various school sites.  As with previous and on-going bond projects, the District will require the assistance of professional service providers, including private architectural firms, construction management services, and inspection services.  
	 
At the Regular Meeting held on June 19, 2008, the Board approved a pool of eleven (11) architectural firms to provide the District with architectural services for the District’s capital improvement and expansion projects for Measure G and E.  The approved list of firms included:
	 
AEDIS Architecture
BFGC Architecture
Cody Anderson Wasney Architects
FMPO
HMC Architects
NTD Architects
Perkins & Will
Spencer Associates
Sugimura Finney Architects
Verde Design, and
WLC Architects
	 
The pool of firms was recommended to, and approved by, the Board after a qualification process that was conducted by a team of staff and others.  In 2009, following an Administration qualification process and recommendation, the Board also approved a pool of four (4) construction management firms to provide construction management services, and a pool of three (3) certified inspection firms to provide inspection services.
	 
To ensure greater transparency in the selection process and in accordance with the recommendations contained in the 2010 FCMAT Extraordinary Audit and the Board-approved contract selection and administration process, Administration proposes to re-issue requests for proposals for architectural services for Measure “E” Phase 2 projects.  Administration will present its recommendations for Phase 2 professional services agreements to the Board at the time of the planned May 31, 2011, Special Meeting.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:  
Authorize Administration to re-issue requests for proposals for architectural services for Measure “E” Phase 2 projects to the eleven (11) private architectural firms previously qualified by the District.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:  
No fiscal impact discernible at this time.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:  
Measure E Bond Program
items.item_recommendation: Authorize Administration to re-issue requests for proposals for architectural services for Measure âEâ Phase 2 projects to the eleven (11) private architectural firms previously qualified by the District.
items.item_text: Review and Approve Recommended Process for Selection of Professional Services for Phase 2 of Measure E Bond Program

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.07
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion, Action and/or Adoption of Board's Goals for 2011-2012
	 
	 
The Board of Trustees, at their Retreat of January 30 and March 5, met to develop a set of Board priority goals for the 2011-2012 school year.  Attached is the outcome of the goals as discussed by the Board of Trustees.  Also attached are the Board retreat goals of January 24, 2009, for the Board's review.
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
 It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt the Board Retreat Goals dated March 5, 2011, for the 2011-2012 school year.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.08
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-38 Declaring May 2-6, 2011, as National Teacher Appreciation Week and May 11, 2011, as California Day of the Teacher
	 
	 
	 
In recognition, appreciation, and celebration of National Teacher Appreciation Week and California Day of the Teacher, East Side Union High School District is requesting adoption of a resolution which declares May 2-6, 2011, as National Teacher Appreciation Week, and May 11, 2011, as California Day of the Teacher.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-38 declaring May 2-6, 2011, as National Teacher Appreciation Week and May 11, 2011, as California Day of the Teacher.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
East Side Union High School District
of
Santa Clara County, State of California
RESOLUTION #2010/2011-38
National Teacher Appreciation Week
May 2-6, 2011
and
Day of the Teacher
May 11, 2011
	 
	 
WHEREAS, teachers make public schools great; and
	 
WHEREAS,teachers work to open students minds to ideas, knowledge and dreams; and
	 
WHEREAS,teachers keep American democracy alive by laying the foundation for good citizenship; and
	 
WHEREAS,teachers fill many roles, as listeners, explorers, role models, motivators and mentors; and
	 
WHEREAS,teachers continue to influence us long after our school days are only memories;
	 
THEREFORE BE IT RESOLVED, by the East Side Union High School District that all teachers be commended for the contributions they make to successful student achievement.
PASSED AND ADOPTED this 21st day of April 2011 by the Governing Board of the East Side Union High School District at its regular meeting held at 830 N. Capitol Avenue, San Jose, State of California.
AYES:   ________
	NOES:   ________
	ABSENT:   ________
	ABSTENTIONS:   ________
	 
I certify that the foregoing resolution was duly introduced, passed, and adopted by the East Side Union High School District Board of Trustees at a meeting held on April 21, 2011.
	_________________________
	Van Le, Clerk
	ESUHSD Board of Trustees

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.09
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2010/2011-39 Declaring May 15-21, 2011, as Classified School Employees Week
	 
	 
	 
In recognition, appreciation and celebration of Classified School Employees Week, the District is requesting adoption of a resolution, which declares May 15-21, 2011, as Classified School Employees Week.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
	It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution #2010/2011-39 declaring May 15-21, 2011, as Classified School Employees Week.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
East Side Union High School District
of
Santa Clara County, State of California
	 
RESOLUTION #2010/2011-39
Classified School Employees Week
May 15-21, 2011
	 
	 
WHEREAS, classified professionals provide valuable services to the schools and students of the East Side Union High School District; and
	 
WHEREAS,classified professionals contribute to the establishment and promotion of a positive instructional environment; and
	 
WHEREAS,classified professionals serve a vital role in providing for the welfare and safety of East Side Union High School District’s students; and 
	 
WHEREAS,classified professionals employed by the East Side Union High School District strive for excellence in all areas relative to the educational community; 
THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, that the East Side Union High School District hereby recognizes and wishes to honor the contributions of classified professionals to quality education in the State of California and in the East Side Union High School District and declares the week of May 15-21, 2011, as Classified School Employees Week in the East Side Union High School District.
PASSED AND ADOPTED this 21st day of April 2011 by the Governing Board of the East Side Union High School District at its regular meeting held at 830 N. Capitol Avenue, San Jose, State of California.
	 
AYES:   ________
	NOES: ________
	 
	ABSENT:   ________
	ABSTENTIONS:   ________
	 
I certify that the foregoing resolution was duly introduced, passed, and adopted by the East Side Union High School District Board of Trustees at a meeting held on April 21, 2011.
	_________________________
	Van Le, Clerk
	ESUHSD Board of Trustees

meeting_sections.section_name: BOARD OF TRUSTEES/SUPERINTENDENT - OPERATIONAL ITEMS/BOARD DISCUSSION AND/OR ACTION

items.item_details:
Item:  10.01
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Robert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional Development/Migrant Education
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive the First Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint Quarterly Report for Period Covering January 1, 2011  through March 31, 2011 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727)
	 
BACKGROUND
As a result of the Williams Case (EC 35186), referred to as a landmark Superior Court case requires that every California public school provide each student with, at the very least, sufficient textbooks and instructional materials; clean, safe and functional buildings and facilities; and permanent, appropriately trained and assigned teachers.  Additionally, under the settlement of the Valenzuela/CAHSEE Settlement (EC 37254) students in grades 10 to 12 inclusive shall be notified of services available to students up to two consecutive years after the completion of grade 12 who have not yet passed the CAHSEE.
	 
School districts shall support summarized data on the nature and resolution of all Williams Complaints and Valenzuela/CAHSEE Complaints on a quarterly basis to the governing board and the county superintendent of schools.  The report shall include the number of complaints by general subject area with the number of resolved and unresolved complaints.
	 
The attached report indicates the number of complaints filed from January 1, 2011 through March 31, 2011.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Senate Bill 6 (Williams)
State Instructional Materials Allocation
District Instructional Materials Budget
Other Categorical Funds as Appropriate
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
The administration recommends that the Governing Board accept the Third Quarterly Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint Report for the period covering January 1, 2011 through March 31, 2011, as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727).
items.item_text: Receive the First Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint Quarterly Report for Period Covering January 1, 2011 through March 31, 2011 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727) - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Robert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional Development/Migrant Education
items.item_text_raw: 10.01 Receive the First Valenzuela/CAHSEE and Williams Settlement Uniform Complaint Quarterly Report for Period Covering January 1, 2011 through March 31, 2011 as required by EC 35186 (Williams Settlement Legislation SB550 and AB2727) - Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction, and Robert Ibarra, Coordinator of Professional Development/Migrant Education

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  10.02
				 
					 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Approve Designation of California Interscholastic Federation (CIF) Representatives to League for 2011-2012
					 
					 
	 
	 
Pursuant to California Interscholastic Federation regulations, league representatives from public and private schools must be designated representatives of the schools’ governing board in order to be eligible to serve on the section and state governance bodies.  A list of personnel from each school in the District has been selected to serve as the school’s CIF league representatives for the 2011-2012 school year.  Each school’s representative shall include the Principal, Associate Principal and Athletic Directors.
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
To Be Determined
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
General Fund
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the listed personnel as league representatives to the California Interscholastic Federation for the 2011-2012 school year.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the listed personnel as league representatives to the California Interscholastic Federation for the 2011-2012 school year.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.01
	 
	 
TO:                               Board of Trustees
	 
FROM:                          Dan Moser, Superintendent
	 
PREPARED BY:            Cathy Giammona, Associate Superintendent, Human Resources and Instruction
	 
SUBJECT:                    Approve Variable Term Waiver Requests for Certificated Employees
	 
	 
Pursuant to State mandate, the Governing Board must approve variable term waiver requests allowing the district to employ and assign teacher(s) or administrator(s) who do not hold appropriate credential authorization.
	 
The district is requesting approval of the following variable term waivers for the 2010-2011 school year.
	 
Single Subject
	 
 KONG, William
 Special Education – Autism
 EvergreenValley High School
 LIEBERMAN, Michael

TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Hardy Childers, Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Accept Warrant Register for the Month of March 2011
		 
		 
Attached is a list of warrants issued during the month of March 2011, in response to board Policy 3314 Payment for Goods and Services adopted by the board in May 2009.  The Policy states that, “The Board shall approve all warrants (checks) at a regularly scheduled Board meeting".  While there is no legal requirement for Board approval of issued warrants, this list and future lists will add to the “transparency” of when the Board approves purchase orders, contracts and other authorized expenses as per Board Policies.
		 
		 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
		 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
		 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees accept the Warrant Register for the month of March 2011.
